message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of natural language processing (cs.CL) because it deals with the identification of contrasting word pairs, which is a fundamental task in natural language processing. Additionally, the paper proposes an automatic method to identify contrasting word pairs that relies on corpus statistics and the structure of a thesaurus, which are common techniques used in natural language processing. 

The paper could also belong to the sub-category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) because the proposed method involves machine learning techniques to identify contrasting word pairs. 

The sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG) is also a possibility because the paper proposes an empirical measure of lexical contrast that relies on corpus statistics and the contrast hypothesis. 

The sub-category of information retrieval (cs.IR) is another possibility because the identification of contrasting word pairs is relevant to information retrieval tasks such as query expansion and document ranking. 

Finally, the sub-category of neural networks (cs.NE) is a possibility because the proposed method involves the use of neural networks to learn the relationship between words and their opposites.
